ide.message:
XREFFILE-STATUS: XREFFILE-STATUS is used to capture the status of operations performed on the cross-reference file (XREF-FILE). It is used to determine the success or failure of file operations such as OPEN, READ, WRITE, and CLOSE.

00 - Operation successful (see app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl:94: 94             IF  XREFFILE-STATUS = '00'                                           )
10 - End of file reached (see app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl:98: 98                 IF  XREFFILE-STATUS = '10'                                       )
00 - Operation successful (see app/cbl/CBTRN01C.cbl:292: 292            IF  XREFFILE-STATUS = '00')
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl
app/cbl/CBSTM03B.CBL
app/cbl/CBACT04C.cbl
app/cbl/CBTRN01C.cbl

TWO-BYTES-BINARY: A binary variable that is used in various parts of the code to hold numeric values in binary format.

0 - The binary representation of zero. (see app/cbl/CBACT01C.cbl:180: 180                MOVE 0        TO TWO-BYTES-BINARY)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT01C.cbl
app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl

END-OF-FILE: The variable END-OF-FILE is used to indicate whether the end of a file has been reached during file processing operations.

N - The end of the file has not been reached. (see app/cbl/CBSTM03A.CBL:70: 70            05  END-OF-FILE         PIC X(01) VALUE 'N'.)
Y - The end of the file has been reached. (see app/cbl/CBSTM03A.CBL:357: 357                MOVE 'Y' TO END-OF-FILE)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBSTM03A.CBL
app/cbl/CBACT01C.cbl

CARD-XREF-RECORD: CARD-XREF-RECORD is a data structure used to store information related to card cross-references. It includes fields for card number, customer ID, account ID, and filler data.


  
Used in the following paths:

app/cpy/CVACT03Y.cpy
app/cbl/CBSTM03A.CBL
app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl
app/cbl/CBTRN01C.cbl
app/cbl/CBTRN02C.cbl
app/cbl/COACTVWC.cbl

APPL-RESULT: APPL-RESULT is used to store the result status of various operations in the application. It is used to determine the success or failure of operations such as file reads, writes, and other transactions.

8 - A specific status or error code. (see app/cbl/CBTRN02C.cbl:450: MOVE 8 TO APPL-RESULT)
0 - Operation successful. (see app/cbl/CBTRN02C.cbl:453: MOVE 0 TO APPL-RESULT)
16 - End-of-file condition. (see app/cbl/CBCUS01C.cbl:99: MOVE 16 TO APPL-RESULT)
12 - A specific error condition. (see app/cbl/CBCUS01C.cbl:101: MOVE 12 TO APPL-RESULT)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBTRN02C.cbl
app/cbl/CBCUS01C.cbl

APPL-AOK: APPL-AOK is a condition name for the variable APPL-RESULT, indicating a successful operation.

0 - Successful operation (see app/cbl/CBACT02C.cbl:62: 88  APPL-AOK            VALUE 0.)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT02C.cbl

APPL-EOF: APPL-EOF is a condition name for the variable APPL-RESULT, which is used to indicate the end of a file in the CardDemo mainframe application.

16 - The end of the file has been reached. (see app/cbl/CBACT01C.cbl:63: 63            88  APPL-EOF            VALUE 16.)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT01C.cbl
app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl

TIMING: TIMING is a binary variable defined in the COBOL program, likely used to store timing or timestamp-related information.

0 - Indicates that the timing or timestamp is reset or initialized. (see app/cbl/CBACT04C.cbl:630: 630            MOVE 0 TO TIMING)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl
app/cbl/CBACT04C.cbl

ABCODE: ABCODE is a variable used to store the abend (abnormal end) code in the application. It is used to indicate specific error or termination conditions.

9999 - Specific abend condition indicated by the value '9999'. (see app/cbl/COCRDSLC.cbl:876: ABCODE('9999'))
999 - Specific abend condition indicated by the value '999'. (see app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl:157: MOVE 999 TO ABCODE)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COCRDSLC.cbl
app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl

IO-STAT1: IO-STAT1 is a single character variable used to store the status of an I/O operation.

9 - Indicates a specific I/O status condition (see app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl:163: OR  IO-STAT1 = '9')
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl

IO-STATUS-04: IO-STATUS-04 is used to store the status of file operations.

0 - Initial or successful status (see app/cbl/CBACT04C.cbl:130: 130            05  IO-STATUS-0401      PIC 9   VALUE 0.)
0 - Initial or successful status (see app/cbl/CBACT04C.cbl:131: 131            05  IO-STATUS-0403      PIC 999 VALUE 0.)
0000 - Initial or successful status (see app/cbl/CBACT04C.cbl:644: 644                MOVE '0000' TO IO-STATUS-04)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl
app/cbl/CBACT04C.cbl

IO-STAT2: IO-STAT2 is a part of the IO-STATUS structure, which is used to capture and handle the status of file operations in the COBOL program.


  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT04C.cbl

TWO-BYTES-RIGHT: TWO-BYTES-RIGHT is a variable defined in the COBOL program to hold a single character value. It is part of a redefined structure that overlays a binary field, allowing for different interpretations of the same memory location.


  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT01C.cbl

IO-STATUS-0403: IO-STATUS-0403 is a variable used to store a three-digit status code related to input/output operations.

0 - No error or default status (see app/cbl/CBACT01C.cbl:59: 59            05  IO-STATUS-0403      PIC 999 VALUE 0.)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT01C.cbl
app/cbl/CBACT03C.cbl

FD-CARD-NUM: FD-CARD-NUM is a 16-character field that represents the credit card number in the CardDemo mainframe application. It is part of the FD-CARDFILE-REC record structure and is used as the record key for accessing records in the CARDFILE-FILE.


  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT02C.cbl

CARDFILE-STATUS: CARDFILE-STATUS is used to determine the status of file operations on the CARDFILE-FILE. It is checked after READ operations to decide the next steps based on whether the read was successful, reached the end of the file, or encountered an error.

00 - Successful read operation (see app/cbl/CBACT02C.cbl:94: 94             IF  CARDFILE-STATUS = '00')
10 - End of file reached (see app/cbl/CBACT02C.cbl:98: 98                 IF  CARDFILE-STATUS = '10')
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT02C.cbl

CARD-RECORD: CARD-RECORD is a data structure representing a card entity in the CardDemo application. It is used to store and manipulate information related to credit cards, such as card number, account ID, CVV code, embossed name, and other relevant details.


  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBACT02C.cbl
app/cpy/CVACT02Y.cpy
app/cbl/COCRDLIC.cbl
app/cbl/COCRDUPC.cbl

FD-CUST-ID: FD-CUST-ID is a variable that represents the customer ID in the CardDemo mainframe application. It is used as a record key for accessing customer records in the customer file (CUST-FILE).

000000001 - Customer ID for the first record in the custdata.txt file. (see app/data/ASCII/custdata.txt:1: 000000001Immanuel                 Madeline                 Kessler                  618 Deshaun Route                                 Apt. 802                                          Altenwerthshire                                   NCUSA12546     (908)119-8310  (373)693-8684  020973888000000000000493684371961-06-080053581756Y274)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBCUS01C.cbl
app/cbl/CBSTM03B.CBL

CUSTFILE-STATUS: CUSTFILE-STATUS is used to capture the status of operations performed on the customer file (CUST-FILE). It is typically used to check the result of file operations such as READ, WRITE, or OPEN.

00 - Successful operation (see app/cbl/CBCUS01C.cbl:94: 94             IF  CUSTFILE-STATUS = '00')
10 - End of file (see app/cbl/CBCUS01C.cbl:98: 98                 IF  CUSTFILE-STATUS = '10')
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBSTM03B.CBL
app/cbl/CBCUS01C.cbl

CUSTOMER-RECORD: This variable is used to store and manipulate customer data records within the application.

000000001Immanuel Madeline Kessler 618 Deshaun Route Apt. 802 Altenwerthshire NCUSA12546 (908)119-8310 (373)693-8684 020973888000000000000493684371961-06-080053581756Y274 - This is an example of a customer record, showing fields such as customer ID, name, address, phone numbers, and other details. (see app/data/ASCII/custdata.txt:1: 000000001Immanuel                 Madeline                 Kessler                  618 Deshaun Route                                 Apt. 802                                          Altenwerthshire                                   NCUSA12546     (908)119-8310  (373)693-8684  020973888000000000000493684371961-06-080053581756Y274)
092387719324733000000000002028Enrico Rosenbaum 2024-08-11Y - This is an example of a customer record in the card data dataset, showing fields such as card number, customer name, expiration date, and status. (see app/data/ASCII/carddata.txt:3: 092387719324733000000000002028Enrico Rosenbaum 2024-08-11Y)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/CBSTM03A.CBL
app/cbl/CBCUS01C.cbl
app/cpy/CUSTREC.cpy
app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl

ERR-FLG-OFF: ERR-FLG-OFF is a condition name for the flag variable WS-ERR-FLG, which indicates whether an error has occurred or not. When ERR-FLG-OFF is set to TRUE, it means no error has occurred.

N - No error has occurred. (see app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl:13:            88 ERR-FLG-OFF                        VALUE 'N'.)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COTRN00C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR00C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl

WS-MESSAGE: WS-MESSAGE is a working-storage variable used to hold messages that are displayed to the user or used for error handling in the application.

CCDA-MSG-THANK-YOU - Thank you message (see app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl:89: MOVE CCDA-MSG-THANK-YOU        TO WS-MESSAGE)
Please enter User ID ... - Prompt for User ID (see app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl:120: MOVE 'Please enter User ID ...' TO WS-MESSAGE)
Please enter Password ... - Prompt for Password (see app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl:125: MOVE 'Please enter Password ...' TO WS-MESSAGE)
User not found. Try again ... - User not found error message (see app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl:249: MOVE 'User not found. Try again ...' TO WS-MESSAGE)
Unable to verify the User ... - User verification error message (see app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl:254: MOVE 'Unable to verify the User ...' TO WS-MESSAGE)
Confirm to add this transaction... - Transaction confirmation prompt (see app/cbl/COTRN02C.cbl:178: MOVE 'Confirm to add this transaction...' TO WS-MESSAGE)
User ID can NOT be empty... - User ID empty error message (see app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl:147: MOVE 'User ID can NOT be empty...' TO WS-MESSAGE)
User ID NOT found... - User ID not found error message (see app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl:325: MOVE 'User ID NOT found...' TO WS-MESSAGE)
User ' + SEC-USR-ID + ' has been deleted ... - User deletion message (see app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl:318-321: MOVE 'User '     DELIMITED BY SIZE
                           SEC-USR-ID  DELIMITED BY SPACE
                           ' has been deleted ...' DELIMITED BY SIZE
                      INTO WS-MESSAGE)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR02C.cbl
app/cbl/CSUTLDTC.cbl
app/cbl/COMEN01C.cbl
app/cbl/COADM01C.cbl
app/cbl/COTRN00C.cbl
app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl
app/cbl/COTRN02C.cbl
app/cbl/COTRN01C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR00C.cbl
app/cbl/CORPT00C.cbl
app/cbl/COBIL00C.cbl

CDEMO-TO-PROGRAM: CDEMO-TO-PROGRAM is used to determine the next program to transfer control to within the CardDemo application.

COSGN00C - Sign-on screen program (see app/cpy/COCOM01Y.cpy:79: MOVE 'COSGN00C' TO CDEMO-TO-PROGRAM)
COADM01C - Administration screen program (see app/cpy/COCOM01Y.cpy:129: MOVE 'COADM01C' TO CDEMO-TO-PROGRAM)
COUSR02C - User selection screen program (see app/cbl/COUSR00C.cbl:192: MOVE 'COUSR02C' TO CDEMO-TO-PROGRAM)
COUSR03C - User detail screen program (see app/cbl/COUSR00C.cbl:202: MOVE 'COUSR03C' TO CDEMO-TO-PROGRAM)
COTRN01C - Transaction selection screen program (see app/cbl/COTRN00C.cbl:188: MOVE 'COTRN01C' TO CDEMO-TO-PROGRAM)
COTRN00C - Transaction screen program (see app/cbl/COTRN01C.cbl:126: MOVE 'COTRN00C' TO CDEMO-TO-PROGRAM)
COMEN01C - Menu screen program (see app/cbl/COBIL00C.cbl:130: MOVE 'COMEN01C' TO CDEMO-TO-PROGRAM)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cpy/COCOM01Y.cpy
app/cbl/COUSR00C.cbl
app/cbl/COTRN00C.cbl
app/cbl/COTRN01C.cbl
app/cbl/COCRDUPC.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl
app/cbl/COBIL00C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl

DFHCOMMAREA: DFHCOMMAREA is a special communication area used in CICS (Customer Information Control System) to pass data between programs.


  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl
app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl

CARDDEMO-COMMAREA: CARDDEMO-COMMAREA is a communication area used in the CardDemo application to pass data between different programs and transactions within the CICS environment. It is defined as a variable-length array that can hold up to 32767 bytes of data, depending on the value of EIBCALEN.

COSGN00C - Program name to be executed next. (see app/cpy/COCOM01Y.cpy:91: MOVE 'COSGN00C' TO CDEMO-TO-PROGRAM)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cpy/COCOM01Y.cpy
app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl
app/cbl/COTRN02C.cbl
app/cbl/COACTVWC.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl

CDEMO-PGM-REENTER: CDEMO-PGM-REENTER is a flag used to indicate whether the program has been re-entered.

1 - The program has been re-entered. (see app/cpy/COCOM01Y.cpy:31: 31                 88 CDEMO-PGM-REENTER          VALUE 1.)
0 - The program is being entered for the first time. (see app/cpy/COCOM01Y.cpy:30: 30                 88 CDEMO-PGM-ENTER            VALUE 0.)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cpy/COCOM01Y.cpy
app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl
app/cbl/COCRDLIC.cbl
app/cbl/COACTVWC.cbl
app/cpy/CSSETATY.cpy
app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl

WS-ERR-FLG: This variable is used to indicate whether an error has occurred.

N - No error (see app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl:40: 05 WS-ERR-FLG                 PIC X(01) VALUE 'N'.)
Y - Error occurred (see app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl:41: 88 ERR-FLG-ON                         VALUE 'Y'.)
N - No error (see app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl:42: 88 ERR-FLG-OFF                        VALUE 'N'.)
Y - Error occurred (see app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl:92: MOVE 'Y'                       TO WS-ERR-FLG)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl
app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl

CCDA-MSG-INVALID-KEY: This variable holds a message string that is used to inform the user that an invalid key was pressed.

Invalid key pressed. Please see below... - The message to be displayed when an invalid key is pressed. (see app/cpy/CSMSG01Y.cpy:20: 20          05 CCDA-MSG-INVALID-KEY       PIC X(50) VALUE)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cpy/CSMSG01Y.cpy
app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl

ERR-FLG-ON: ERR-FLG-ON is a condition name for the variable WS-ERR-FLG, which indicates whether an error has occurred.

Y - An error has occurred. (see app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl:11: 88 ERR-FLG-ON VALUE 'Y'.)
N - No error has occurred. (see app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl:12: 88 ERR-FLG-OFF VALUE 'N'.)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl
app/cbl/COMEN01C.cbl
app/cbl/COTRN02C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR00C.cbl
app/cbl/CORPT00C.cbl
app/cbl/COTRN00C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl

SEC-USR-ID: SEC-USR-ID is an 8-character alphanumeric field used to store and manipulate user IDs in the CardDemo mainframe application. It is part of the SEC-USER-DATA structure and is used in various operations such as reading, writing, and processing user security data.

LOW-VALUES - Uninitialized or empty user ID (see app/cbl/COUSR00C.cbl:219: 219                MOVE LOW-VALUES TO SEC-USR-ID)
HIGH-VALUES - User ID not found or end of range (see app/cbl/COUSR00C.cbl:263: 263                MOVE HIGH-VALUES TO SEC-USR-ID)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cpy/CSUSR01Y.cpy
app/cbl/COUSR00C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR02C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl

SEC-USR-FNAME: This variable represents the first name of a user in the security dataset.


  
Used in the following paths:

app/cpy/CSUSR01Y.cpy
app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR02C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR00C.cbl

SEC-USR-LNAME: This variable represents the last name of a user in the security dataset.


  
Used in the following paths:

app/cpy/CSUSR01Y.cpy
app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR02C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR00C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl

SEC-USR-PWD: SEC-USR-PWD is a variable that holds the password of a user in the CardDemo mainframe application. It is part of the SEC-USER-DATA structure, which contains various user-related information.


  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COUSR02C.cbl
app/cpy/CSUSR01Y.cpy
app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl
app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl

app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl

app/cbl/COMEN01C.cbl

WS-TRANID: WS-TRANID is a variable that holds a transaction identifier, which is used to identify and manage different types of transactions within the mainframe application.

CU01 - Transaction ID for the COUSR01C program. (see app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl:37: 05 WS-TRANID                  PIC X(04) VALUE 'CU01'.)
CU03 - Transaction ID for the COUSR03C program. (see app/cbl/COUSR03C.cbl:37: 05 WS-TRANID                  PIC X(04) VALUE 'CU03'.)
CC00 - Transaction ID for the COSGN00C program. (see app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl:37: 05 WS-TRANID                  PIC X(04) VALUE 'CC00'.)
CB00 - Transaction ID for the COBIL00C program. (see app/cbl/COBIL00C.cbl:38: 05 WS-TRANID                  PIC X(04) VALUE 'CB00'.)
CA00 - Transaction ID for the COADM01C program. (see app/cbl/COADM01C.cbl:37: 05 WS-TRANID                  PIC X(04) VALUE 'CA00'.)
CU02 - Transaction ID for the COUSR02C program. (see app/cbl/COUSR02C.cbl:37: 05 WS-TRANID                  PIC X(04) VALUE 'CU02'.)
CU00 - Transaction ID for the COUSR00C program. (see app/cbl/COUSR00C.cbl:37: 05 WS-TRANID                  PIC X(04) VALUE 'CU00'.)
CM00 - Transaction ID for the COMEN01C program. (see app/cbl/COMEN01C.cbl:37: 05 WS-TRANID                  PIC X(04) VALUE 'CM00'.)
CT01 - Transaction ID for the COTRN01C program. (see app/cbl/COTRN01C.cbl:37: 05 WS-TRANID                  PIC X(04) VALUE 'CT01'.)
CT02 - Transaction ID for the COTRN02C program. (see app/cbl/COTRN02C.cbl:37: 05 WS-TRANID                  PIC X(04) VALUE 'CT02'.)
CR00 - Transaction ID for the CORPT00C program. (see app/cbl/CORPT00C.cbl:38: 05 WS-TRANID                  PIC X(04) VALUE 'CR00'.)
CT00 - Transaction ID for the COTRN00C program. (see app/cbl/COTRN00C.cbl:37: 05 WS-TRANID                  PIC X(04) VALUE 'CT00'.)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl

CDEMO-FROM-TRANID: CDEMO-FROM-TRANID is used to store the transaction ID from which the control is being transferred.

LOW-VALUES - Lowest possible value for the data type. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:930: 930 IF CDEMO-FROM-TRANID EQUAL LOW-VALUES)
SPACES - String of space characters. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:931: 931 OR CDEMO-FROM-TRANID EQUAL SPACES)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cpy/COCOM01Y.cpy
app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl
app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl

WS-PGMNAME: WS-PGMNAME is used to store the name of the current program.

COUSR01C - The name of the program is COUSR01C. (see app/cbl/COUSR01C.cbl:36: 05 WS-PGMNAME PIC X(08) VALUE 'COUSR01C'.)
COSGN00C - The name of the program is COSGN00C. (see app/cbl/COSGN00C.cbl:36: 05 WS-PGMNAME PIC X(08) VALUE 'COSGN00C'.)

CCUP-CHANGES-MADE: This variable is used to indicate the status of changes made in the Credit Card Update program (COCRDUPC).

N - Not Confirmed (see app/cbl/COCRDUPC.cbl:282: 282                 88 CCUP-CHANGES-MADE               VALUES 'E', 'N')
C - Confirmed (see app/cbl/COCRDUPC.cbl:283: 283                                                         , 'C', 'L')
L - Locked (see app/cbl/COCRDUPC.cbl:283: 283                                                         , 'C', 'L')
F - Finalized (see app/cbl/COCRDUPC.cbl:284: 284                                                         , 'F'.)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COCRDUPC.cbl

WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUM: This variable is used to store and manipulate US phone numbers in the format (999)999-9999.

000 - The phone number is invalid. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:102: 88 WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-IS-INVALID      VALUE '000'.)
LOW-VALUES - The phone number is valid. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:103: 88 WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-IS-VALID        VALUE LOW-VALUES.)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl

WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMA: This variable represents the area code part of a US phone number in the WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUM structure.

SPACES - The area code part of the phone number is empty. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:2234: 2234            IF  (WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMA EQUAL SPACES)
SPACES - The area code part of the phone number is empty. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:2247: 2247            IF WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMA EQUAL SPACES)
LOW-VALUES - The area code part of the phone number is set to the lowest possible value. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:2248: 2248            OR WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMA EQUAL LOW-VALUES)
0 - The area code part of the phone number is zero. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:2280: 2280            IF  WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMA-N = 0)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl

WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMB: This variable is part of the US phone number editing structure and represents the second segment of a US phone number, typically the central office code.

SPACES - The variable is empty or uninitialized. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:2236: 2236            AND (WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMB EQUAL SPACES)
LOW-VALUES - The variable is uninitialized or set to a default low value. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:2237: 2237            OR   WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMB EQUAL LOW-VALUES))
SPACES - The variable is empty or uninitialized. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:2318: 2318            IF WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMB EQUAL SPACES)
LOW-VALUES - The variable is uninitialized or set to a default low value. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:2319: 2319            OR WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMB EQUAL LOW-VALUES)
0 - The variable is uninitialized or set to a default value. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:2351: 2351            IF  WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMB-N = 0)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl

WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMC: This variable is part of the structure used to store and validate US phone numbers. It specifically holds the last four digits of the phone number.

LOW-VALUES - The lowest value in the collating sequence. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:2239: 2239            OR   WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMC EQUAL LOW-VALUES))
SPACES - A string of space characters. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:2371: 2371            IF WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMC EQUAL SPACES)
0 - The numeric value zero. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:2404: 2404            IF  WS-EDIT-US-PHONE-NUMC-N = 0)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl

WS-EDIT-US-SSN-PART1: This variable represents the first part of a US Social Security Number (SSN) and is used for validation purposes.

0 - Invalid SSN part 1 (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:121: 88 INVALID-SSN-PART1  VALUES      0,)
666 - Invalid SSN part 1 (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:122: 88 INVALID-SSN-PART1  VALUES      666,)
900-999 - Invalid SSN part 1 (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:123: 88 INVALID-SSN-PART1  VALUES      900 THRU 999.)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl

WS-EDIT-US-SSN-PART2: This variable is part of the Social Security Number (SSN) edit fields, specifically representing the second part of the SSN, which is typically the two-digit group number.

0 - Indicates that the SSN part 2 is not valid (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:141: 88 FLG-EDIT-US-SSN-PART2-NOT-OK VALUE '0'.)
B - Indicates that the SSN part 2 is blank (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:142: 88 FLG-EDIT-US-SSN-PART2-BLANK VALUE 'B'.)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl

WS-EDIT-US-SSN-PART3: This variable represents the third part of a US Social Security Number (SSN) in the application.

0 - The value is considered not okay if it is '0'. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:145: 88 FLG-EDIT-US-SSN-PART3-NOT-OK   VALUE '0'.)
B - The value is considered blank if it is 'B'. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:146: 88 FLG-EDIT-US-SSN-PART3-BLANK    VALUE 'B'.)
  
Used in the following paths:

app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl

WS-EDIT-US-SSN: This variable is used to store and validate a US Social Security Number (SSN) by breaking it into three parts and applying specific validation rules to each part.

000 - Invalid SSN (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:133: 88 WS-EDIT-US-SSN-IS-INVALID         VALUE '000'.)
  
Used in the following paths:

WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME: This variable is used to store the name of the variable being edited in the program. It is primarily used for error messaging and logging purposes.

Account Status - The variable being edited is the account status. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:1472: MOVE 'Account Status'          TO WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME)
Open Date - The variable being edited is the open date. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:1478: MOVE 'Open Date'              TO WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME)
Credit Limit - The variable being edited is the credit limit. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:1484: MOVE 'Credit Limit'           TO WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME)
Expiry Date - The variable being edited is the expiry date. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:1490: MOVE 'Expiry Date'            TO WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME)
Cash Credit Limit - The variable being edited is the cash credit limit. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:1496: MOVE 'Cash Credit Limit'      TO WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME)
Reissue Date - The variable being edited is the reissue date. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:1503: MOVE 'Reissue Date'           TO WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME)
Current Balance - The variable being edited is the current balance. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:1509: MOVE 'Current Balance'        TO WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME)
Current Cycle Credit Limit - The variable being edited is the current cycle credit limit. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:1515: MOVE 'Current Cycle Credit Limit' TO WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME)
Current Cycle Debit Limit - The variable being edited is the current cycle debit limit. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:1522: MOVE 'Current Cycle Debit Limit' TO WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME)
SSN - The variable being edited is the social security number. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:1529: MOVE 'SSN'                    TO WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME)
Date of Birth - The variable being edited is the date of birth. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:1533: MOVE 'Date of Birth'          TO WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME)
FICO Score - The variable being edited is the FICO score. (see app/cbl/COACTUPC.cbl:1545: MOVE 'FICO Score'             TO WS-EDIT-VARIABLE-NAME)
